name: [Gate Racer]
description:
Set in the far distant future, [Gate Racer] asks the player to complete a clean lap of the Old Armidale Circuit and trigger the bell on each of the ancient gates.  

[Gate Racer] can be described as a cross between Ratbag's Powerslide game of 1998 and Codemaster's Colin McRae Rally.  It has been designed to play with an X-Box controller, although it is also possible (not recconmended) to use a keyboard (use 'ENTER' to select menu buttons).  Steering wheels have not been tested and are not supported.

The game uses Unity's High Definition Render Pipeline because I thought it looked cool, but that means it needs a bit of a gaming PC to run it well.

Currently there is only one track, no easy mode and is manual shifting only.  

Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

OS: Windows 7

Processor: 64-bit from at least 2016

Memory: 4 GB RAM

Graphics: Dedicated graphics card

Storage: 1 GB available space
